channel.title: Anyone want to open a new RSC Server?
channel.description:
I would like to run a RSC Server with someone talented and motivated. The server will be a Replica to start off with, updates/customs to improve it will depend on what the community votes for. Server will be for Skillers, Stakers and PKers, All-in-one. The financial side of the server will be handled by myself.
I would like this Server to hold lots of events everyday for all levels, so everyone can get in on the action, there should be at least one level 3 event everyday so everyone can participate, rewards will be different, some events will have a Cash prize as a reward paid through PayPal.
The economy will be balanced as this is a All-in-one server. All rares/in game items will NOT be sold for money, and neither will there be a drop rate increase for subscribers. This way everyone has a fair chance to gain items and make money the correct way.
Name: TBC XP Rate: Around 5-10x (TBC) Type: All-in-one. Similar to RSC with community voted updates/customs.
This server has financial backing by myself, so the players do not have to worry about it shutting down after a month.
PM Me if you're interested.

item.title: Anyone want to open a new RSC Server?
item.dc:creator: @Anc13nts9 Anc13nts9
item.description:
@Anc13nts9 wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:32, topic:554986”]You know what - what if the server allowed gambling with real money instead of ‘mining’ it?

For example, there could be tournaments with prize pools and so on.

Or it could just be the case that you ‘stake’ a certain amount when pking (and maybe the system ensures that only people with risk commensurate to your own can pk you)? I’m thinking similar to the the Bounty Hunter skulls from RS2 during that era of PVP.[/quote]

Do it. What you said would be perfect.

Read full topic
item.source: Anyone want to open a new RSC Server?

@lothy wrote:

You know what - what if the server allowed gambling with real money instead of ‘mining’ it?

For example, there could be tournaments with prize pools and so on.

Or it could just be the case that you ‘stake’ a certain amount when pking (and maybe the system ensures that only people with risk commensurate to your own can pk you)? I’m thinking similar to the the Bounty Hunter skulls from RS2 during that era of PVP.

item.title: Anyone want to open a new RSC Server?
item.dc:creator: @Anc13nts9 Anc13nts9
item.description:
@Anc13nts9 wrote:

Zoso_:

Interesting idea. But is Bitcoin integration in a server legal in the US?

Should be legal? Bitcoin isn’t illegal. But who cares, just host it offshore

[quote=“Miss Silabsoft, post:29, topic:554986”][quote author=Rodgerwilco link=topic=673911.msg4505841#msg4505841 date=1458274753]
I posted a long time ago about having a central system in place for RSC server owners to use so account information was never lost (they could use the same stats across all servers) Obviously this wouldn’t work because people could just manipulate the data as they wanted.

I do however like the idea of having a central system for RSC server owners to implement a currency. Maybe we could make our own currency but the question is, how would it be distributed/mined/earned?
[/quote]

I don’t know about stats but a centeralized login/friend server that could be used among servers would work fine stats and items can be server specific.[/quote]

I’ll give you 5 bitcoin to make me a bitcoin pking server with withdrawals/deposits, starting everyone with 1 cent when they login(from personal stash that is deposited to the server).

Read full topic

item.title: Anyone want to open a new RSC Server?
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

How would you stop people circumventing it when they have complete control on their end?

By the way, I had an idea yesterday re: DDoS prevention/mitigation. What if you hosted the server in the cloud (e.g.: using Microsoft Azure) and made the server only available to other servers behind Microsoft’s firewalls?
Then you get people to pay for their own VM on Azure, install a proxy server on it, and access the game that way?

You could have a few people per proxy VM, and those people share the cost (it’d probably work out less than $2/month each). The game server is DDoS protected by virtue of only being accessible from within the Microsoft Azure network.

/thoughtbubble

Read full topic

I do however like the idea of having a central system for RSC server owners to implement a currency. Maybe we could make our own currency but the question is, how would it be distributed/mined/earned?

item.title: Anyone want to open a new RSC Server?
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

[quote=“Ecko, post:17, topic:554986”][quote author=sini link=topic=673911.msg4505804#msg4505804 date=1458206367]
Do not ask why, ask why not!

You should create a small article in Programming about UDP and mechanisms to make that work, I’d love to give it a read
[/quote]http://fabiensanglard.net/quake3/network.php[/quote]
That’s one way. Another way is to distinguish between ‘messages’ and ‘packets’. One packet might contain n messages.
The receiving end then ACKs the messages received using a bitfield (so each message is ACK’d 33 times).

Why do this? Because messages that don’t need to arrive don’t have to be re-sent if they aren’t ACK’d; you just fire and forget (e.g.: teleport bubbles, skilling bubbles, etc).

Read full topic

item.title: Anyone want to open a new RSC Server?
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

I’d like to see the following:

  1. Server implemented in C# (far nicer language to work with than Java)
  2. Client converted to utilise UDP instead of TCP.

It’d be cool.

Anyway, the problem I see with Bitcoin (or crypto currency flavour of the month) is that people needing to pay money to play would probably alienate a lot of would-be players.

Read full topic

item.title: Anyone want to open a new RSC Server?
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

my vision of a rsc bitcoin server would be pvp centric, gold would represent bitcoins and could be freely exchanged for every gold ingame would be bitcoin sent to the server. and can equally be withdrawn.

obviously the main objective would be to pk other players and earn their loot as it has a real world value.

basically stork pk meets second life. due to bitcoins ability to go to the 8th decimal place you could make items worth fraction of a cent to keep the real world risk low and still enjoyable. Just a little spice to make the standard pk server a little less “boring”

skilling can be for those who don’t want to throw money into the game for example pkers would still need food and if they didn’t desire fish for themselves they could purchase from other players gold (bitcoins). items may be earned in the usual methods (weaposn and armor would degrade if earned freely) but only those that had been purchased for bitcoin can be sold for gold to exchange back to bitcoin.

Obviously balancing between free and paid would be the hard part of bringing such a server to life, the server would probably also need to find a way to support incoming new players by giving them x coins for free to get players going. possibly with advertising. You could even support such effects with one of those app offer walls that they have for mobile gaming platforms.

Only downside I really see to it is that bitcoins transaction fee’s are a little hefty these days however litecoin or another altcoin could be more suitable for such a project.

Read full topic
item.source: Anyone want to open a new RSC Server?
